etymons.meaning: to become big; to increase; to grow up

Preterit Intransitive.turoyo: rabi 348; 115/150; Пример отсутствует в указанном месте; ko-boxeno ʕal i=dukṯo d-matarko-lan, i=walaye d-baban, d-rabina ebai=naʕam-aṯe ḥəzyoli bəḥto w-amṭoli maḥtoli taḥte gḏayto i=gḏayto məfqola w-rabyo ʕam az=zoġune
translations: ‘I am crying about the place we left, the town of our father, where we grew up’ 73/202;
‘This ostrich… I found an egg, brought it and put it under a hen. And the hen hatched it (the ostrich, f.). And it grew among chicken’ 81/74-75;

Preterit.turoyo: fayəš tamo w mrabele ač=čelikatayḏe 414; 60/18; ono mrabéli-lax xd-i=barṯáyḏi-hat 415; 88/38;ǧbiri u=ahl d-i=qriṯo zwənne ʕeze ġayr m-anək ḥatta d-monaq-qe aṣ=ṣafure d-aʕ=ʕez-anəkmraballe aṣ=ṣafur-aṯṯe
translations: er blieb da und zog seine Vöglein gross
ich habe dich doch grossgezogen und du bist wie meine Tochter
‘The villagers had to buy new goats so that they could suckle the kids of the previous (stolen) ones. So they (these new goats) nurtured the kids’ 85/17-19;

Preterit-wa.turoyo: kīt zlām (…) kət-wa gabe zʕuro u=abro d-i=ḥoṯ-ayḏe yatumo fayəš-wa mrabe-way-le hiye
translations: ‘There was a man (…). There was (also) a boy (at his place), son of his sister. He had become an orphan, and he (the man) had raised him’ 76/2;

Infectum.turoyo: marfele u=səsyayḏe, w ko-mrabe i=moharṯ-ayo 419; 70/74; b-mə gə-mrabyal-le 421; 69/252, 254;
translations: da liess er sein Pferd laufen und zog dieses Füllen gross

Part. act..turoyo: Məḏyaḏ…i=mrabyoniṯo, d-i=xōrte, w d-u=xōrt suryoyo mnawro! ḏḏ; 11/70
translations: …Erziehrin der gebildeten Jungfrau und des gebildeten syrischen Jünglings!’

Part. Pass..turoyo: u=ṭayr-ano mrabyo u=ṭayr-ano kádi-yo, ʕal i=iḏo ko-mrabəl-le 424; 70/107;
translations: jemandem grossgezogen, er ist zahm, man zieht ihn auf der Hand gross
